entry.title: notes for programming elixir conventional programming
entry.content:
part I conventional programming的内容

  1. pattern matching
  2. Immutability
  3. Elixir Basic
  4. Anonymous Functions
  5. Modules and Named Functions
  6. Lists and Recursion
  7. Maps, HashDicts, Keyword, and Sets
  8. What are types
  9. Processing Collections–Enums and Stream
  10. String and Binaries
  11. Control Flow
  12. Organizing a Project

pattern matching

与Erlang里的pattern match差不多，不过elixir里的变量可以重复绑定不同的值，如果要和erlang一致，需要在变量前面加^

iex> a = 1
1
iex> a = 2
2
iex> ^a = 1
** (MatchError) no match of right hand side value: 1

Immutability

关于mutable语言的问题：

GOTO was evil because we asked, “how did I get to this point of execution?” Mutability leaves us with, “how did I get to this state”

在Elixir里，值是immutable,只有变量可以重新绑定。

为提高性能，Elixir对数据的操作应该在列表头部插入

大部分语言采用GC,但有性能问题。Elixir使用大量的process，每个process有自己的heap，GC较容易，而且当process结束时，可以直接删掉所有数据，不需要GC

Elixir Basics

Elixir有下面built-in types

  1. Value types
    1. Arbitary-sized integers
    2. Floating point numbers
    3. Atoms
    4. Regular expressions
    5. Ranges
  2. System types
    1. PIDs and Ports
    2. References
  3. Collection types
    1. Tuples
    2. Lists
    3. Maps
    4. Binaries

Functions, Strings, Lists/Maps/Dictionary在单独的章节里讲到。

Value types

  1. Integers: 1234, 0xcafe, 0765, 0b1010, 1_000_000
  2. Floating point numbers: 1.0 0.2345, 0.3123e1, 313451.0e-5
  3. Atoms: 类似ruby的symbol，:fred, :is_binary?, :<>, :“func/3”
  4. Ranges: start..end, 3..7
  5. Regular expressions: ~r{regexp}, ~r{regexp}opts

可以用Regex module

iex> Regex.run ~r{[aeiou]}, "caterpillar"
["a"]
iex> Regex.scan ~r{[aeiou]}, "caterpillar"
[["a"], ["e"], ["i"], ["a"]]
iex> Regex.split ~r{[aeiou]}, "caterpillar"
["c", "t", "rp", "ll", "r"]
iex> Regex.replace ~r{[aeiou]}, "caterpillar", "*"
"c*t*rp*ll*r"

System Types

  1. Pids and Ports. 获取当前的pid用self, spawn新process时会得到他的pid
  2. References: make_ref会返回一个global的reference

Collection Types

  1. Tuples, 同erlang里的tuples一样
  2. Records, 基于tuples, 是用来命名tuples里的fields
iex> defrecord Phone, country: "1", area: "555", local: nil
iex> number1 = Phone.new
Phone[country: "1", area: "555", local: nil]
iex> number2 = Phone.new local: "1212", country: "44"
Phone[country: "44", area: "555", local: "1212"]

defrecord创建了一个elixir module,具有new function，这个new function从参数创建一个tuple，tuple的第一个元素是module name，其他是tuple values 在iex里会被自动识别为一个record

  1. Lists and Keyword Lists
iex> [ 1, 2, 3 ] ++ [ 4, 5, 6 ]
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
iex> [1, 2, 3, 4] -- [2, 4]
[1, 3]
iex> 1 in [1,2,3,4]
true
iex> "wombat" in [1, 2, 3, 4]
false

Keyword list 是一个用于key/value pair的shortcut

[ name: "Dave", city: "Dallas", likes: "Programming" ]

[ {:name, "Dave"}, {:city, "Dallas"}, {:likes, "Programming"} ]

DB.save record, [ {:use_transaction, true}, {:logging, "HIGH"} ]

DB.save record, use_transaction: true, logging: "HIGH"
  1. Maps: a collection of key/value pairs, like %{key => value, key => value}
iex> states = %{ "AL" => "Alabama", "WI" => "Wisconsin" }
%{"AL" => "Alabama", "WI" => "Wisconsin"}
iex> response_types = %{ { :error, :enoent } => :fatal,
...> { :error, :busy } => :retry }
%{{:error, :busy} => :retry, {:error, :enoent} => :fatal}
iex> colors = %{ :red => 0xff0000, :green => 0x00ff00, :blue => 0x0000ff }
%{blue: 255, green: 65280, red: 16711680}

如果map的key是atom类型，那么也可以用keyword list的shortcut

为什么要有keyword list和map？

map不允许重复的key，keyword可以，map效率高，而且可以用pattern matching

通常keyword list可以用于命令行参数，map和HashDict可以用于关联数组

访问map

iex> states = %{ "AL" => "Alamaba", "WI" => "Wisconsin" }
%{"AL" => "Alamaba", "WI" => "Wisconsin"}
iex> states["AL"]
"Alamaba"
iex> states["TX"]
nil

#如果key是atom，可以使用dot形式
iex> colors = %{ red: 0xff0000, green: 0x00ff00, blue: 0x0000ff }
%{blue: 255, green: 65280, red: 16711680}
iex(27)> colors[:red]
16711680
iex(28)> colors.green
65280
  1. Binaries, 形式如<< 1,2 >>
iex> bin = <<3 :: size(2), 5 :: size(4), 1 :: size(2)>>
<<213>>
iex> :io.format("~-8.2b~n", :binary.bin_to_list(bin))
11010101
:ok
iex> size bin
1

Names, Source Files, Conventions, Operators

Module, record, protocol, and behavior names start with an uppercase letter and are BumpyCase. All other identifiers start with a lower case letter or underscore

Anonymous Functions

fn
  parameter-list -> body
  parameter-list -> body ...
end
  1. 函数可以在参数做pattern matching
  2. 函数可以有多个函数体
  3. 函数可以返回函数
  4. 函数可以作为参数传入
#& shortcut

iex> add_one = &(&1 + 1)
# same as add_one = fn (n) -> n + 1 end
#Function<6.17052888 in :erl_eval.expr/5>
iex> add_one.(44)
45
iex> square = &(&1 * &1)
#Function<6.17052888 in :erl_eval.expr/5>
iex> square.(8)
64
#elixir会优化下面的代码，直接调用IO.puts
iex> speak = &(IO.puts(&1))
&IO.puts/1
iex> speak.("Hello")
Hello
:ok

#第二种形式：
iex> l = &length/1
&:erlang.length/1
iex> l.([1,3,5,7])
4

Modules and Named Functions

这章讲如何使用命名函数，和在module里放置这些函数

defmodule Times do
  def double(n) do
    n * 2
  end
end

do … end 是语法糖，编译时都会转化为后do: 这种形式

def double(n), do: n * 2

def greet(greeting, name), do: (
  IO.puts "How're you doing, #{name}"
)

default parameters

defmodule Example do
  def func(p1, p2 \\ 2, p3 \\ 3, p4) do
    IO.inspect [p1, p2, p3, p4]
  end
end

|> pipe operator会把左边的expression作为右边函数的第一个参数

Modules

modules在elixir里作为namespaces,可以wrap named functions, macros, structs, protocols, 和其他modules

实际上，所有module都定义在top level，Elixir只是自动通过.来连接外部module

Directives for Modules

import 把module里的function/macro放到正在运行的scope

defmodule Example do
  def func1 do
    List.flatten [1,[2,3],4]
  end
  def func2 do
    import List, only: [flatten: 1]
    flatten [5,[6,7],8]
  end
end
#syntax 是 import Module [, only: [except: ]

import List, only: [ flatten: 1, duplicate: 2 ]

alias

定义module的别名

require

如果需要使用定义在module的macro，就要使用require

Module Attributes

@name value

只可以在module顶部定义值，但是可在其他地方读取值,这不是变量，通常用于设置

Module Names: Elixir, Erlang, and Atoms

module name实际上是atom

ex> is_atom IO
true
iex> to_string IO
"Elixir.IO"
iex> :"Elixir.IO" === IO
true

iex> IO.puts 123
123
:ok
iex> :"Elixir.IO".puts 123
123
:ok

在Erlang里，变量才是大写开头，atom是小写的，Erlang里的timer module在Elixir就是:timer,所以需要用下面的方式调用ERlang module

iex> :io.format("The number is ~3.1f~n", [5.678])
The number is 5.7
:ok

寻找Library

expm.co

Lists and Recursion

  1. 使用Head, Tail处理List
  2. 使用Head, Tail创建List
  3. Map function
  4. 在recursion时保持值
  5. sum函数
  6. 复杂的List Patterns
  7. List Module
  def len ([]) do
    0
  end

  def len([h|t]) do
    1 + len(t)
  end

  def square([]) do
    []
  end

  def square([h|t]) do
    [h*h | square(t)]
  end

  def add1([]) do
    []
  end
  def add1([h|t]) do
    [h+1|add1(t)]
  end

  def map([], fun) do
    []
  end
  def map([h|t], fun) do
    [fun.(h)|map(t, fun)]
  end

  def sum(d), do: _sum(d,0)
  defp _sum([],s) do
    s
  end
  defp _sum([h|t],s) do
    _sum(t,s+h)
  end

  def reduce([], init_val, fun), do: init_val
  def reduce([h|t], init_val, fun) do
    reduce(t, fun.(init_val,h), fun)
  end

  def for_location([], target_loc), do: []
  def for_location([ head = [_, target_loc, _, _ ] | tail], target_loc) do
    [ head | for_location(tail, target_loc) ]
  end
  def for_location([ _ | tail], target_loc), do: for_location(tail, target_loc)

end

# 头部不必只有一个元素
iex> [ 1, 2, 3 | [ 4, 5, 6 ]]
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]

List Module

#
# Concatenate lists
#
iex> [1,2,3] ++ [4,5,6]
[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
#
# Flatten
#
iex> List.flatten([[[1], 2], [[[3]]]])
[1, 2, 3]
#
# Folding (like reduce, but can choose direction)
#
iex> List.foldl([1,2,3], "", fn value, acc -> "#{value}(#{acc})" end)
"3(2(1()))"
iex> List.foldr([1,2,3], "", fn value, acc -> "#{value}(#{acc})" end)
"1(2(3()))"
#
# Merging lists and splitting them apart
#
iex> l = List.zip([[1,2,3], [:a,:b,:c], ["cat", "dog"]])
[{1, :a, "cat"}, {2, :b, "dog"}]
iex> List.unzip(l)
[[1, 2], [:a, :b], ["cat", "dog"]]
#
# Accessing tuples within lists
#
iex> kw = [{:name, "Dave"}, {:likes, "Programming"}, {:where, "Dallas", "TX"}]
[{:name, "Dave"}, {:likes, "Programming"}, {:where, "Dallas", "TX"}]
iex> List.keyfind(kw, "Dallas", 1)
{:where, "Dallas", "TX"}
iex> List.keyfind(kw, "TX", 2)
{:where, "Dallas", "TX"}
iex> List.keyfind(kw, "TX", 1)
nil
iex> List.keyfind(kw, "TX", 1, "No city called TX")
"No city called TX"
iex> kw = List.keydelete(kw, "TX", 2)
[name: "Dave", likes: "Programming"]
iex> kw = List.keyreplace(kw, :name, 0, {:first_name, "Dave"})
[first_name: "Dave", likes: "Programming"]

Maps, HashDicts, Keyword, and Sets

Dictionary是一种把key和value关联起来的数据类型

如何在Map，HashDict和Keyword之间选

  1. 如果有重复key： Keyword
  2. 如果需要有序： Keyword
  3. pattern matching： map
  4. 数据大于几百条： HashDict

Dict

Map和HashDict实现了Dict的behaviour，Keyword实现了大部分，应该用Dict module的method，这样不管底层是用map还是HashDict，都会带来更多的灵活性。

Dictionaries

defmodule Sum do
  def values(dict) do
    dict |> Dict.values |> Enum.sum
  end
end
# Sum a HashDict
hd = [ one: 1, two: 2, three: 3 ] |> Enum.into HashDict.new
IO.puts Sum.values(hd) # => 6
# Sum a Map
map = %{ four: 4, five: 5, six: 6 }
IO.puts Sum.values(map) # => 15

# Dict API examples
iex> kw_list = [name: "Dave", likes: "Programming", where: "Dallas"]
[name: "Dave", likes: "Programming", where: "Dallas"]
iex> hashdict = Enum.into kw_list, HashDict.new
#HashDict<[name: "Dave", where: "Dallas", likes: "Programming"]>
iex> map = Enum.into kw_list, Map.new
%{likes: "Programming", name: "Dave", where: "Dallas"}
iex> kw_list[:name]
"Dave"
iex> hashdict[:likes]
"Programming"
iex> map[:where]
"Dallas"
iex> hashdict = Dict.drop(hashdict, [:where, :likes])
#HashDict<[name: "Dave"]>
iex> hashdict = Dict.put(hashdict, :also_likes, "Ruby")
#HashDict<[name: "Dave", also_likes: "Ruby"]>
iex> combo = Dict.merge(map, hashdict)
%{also_likes: "Ruby", likes: "Programming", name: "Dave", where: "Dallas"}

# 用Keyword module读duplicated keyword
iex(51)> kw_list = [name: "Dave", likes: "Programming", likes: "Elixir"]
[name: "Dave", likes: "Programming", likes: "Elixir"]
iex(53)> kw_list[:likes]
"Programming"
iex(54)> Dict.get(kw_list, :likes)
"Programming"
iex(55)> Keyword.get_values(kw_list, :likes)
["Programming", "Elixir"]

Pattern Matching and updating map

对于map，经常会问下面的问题

  1. is there an entry with the key :name ?
  2. are there entries for the keys :name and :height ?
  3. does the entry with key :name have the value “Dave” ?
iex> person = %{ name: "Dave", height: 1.88 }
%{height: 1.88, name: "Dave"}
iex> %{ name: a_name } = person
%{height: 1.88, name: "Dave"}
iex> a_name
"Dave"
iex> %{ name: _, height: _ } = person
%{height: 1.88, name: "Dave"}
iex> %{ name: "Dave" } = person
%{height: 1.88, name: "Dave"}


#利用在map里的解构,简化pattern matching

for person = %{ height: height } <- people,
  height > 1.5,
  do: IO.inspect person

Limitation: 只能在值做pattern matching, 不能在key做pattern matching

update map

new_map = %{ old_map | key => value, ... }

Maps and Structs

当使用 %{}时，elixir知道这是一个map，但不知道更多的结构信息，因此引入Struct

可以创建一种map，但是有固定的fields，缺省值，pattern matching可以用content或者type

Struct是一个module，封装了限制形式的map，module的名字也是map类型的名字

defmodule Subscriber do
  defstruct name: "", paid: false, over_18: true
end

$ iex defstruct.exs
iex> s1 = %Subscriber{}
%Subscriber{name: "", over_18: true, paid: false}
iex> s2 = %Subscriber{ name: "Dave" }
%Subscriber{name: "Dave", over_18: true, paid: false}
iex> s3 = %Subscriber{ name: "Mary", paid: true }
%Subscriber{name: "Mary", over_18: true, paid: true}

#可以用.或pattern matching来访问field

iex> s3.name
"Mary"
iex> %Subscriber{name: a_name} = s3
%Subscriber{name: "Mary", over_18: true, paid: true}
iex> a_name
"Mary"

#update

iex> s4 = %Subscriber{ s3 | name: "Marie"}
%Subscriber{name: "Marie", over_18: true, paid: true}

用module封装Struct的目的是可以定义struct特定的行为

defmodule Attendee do
  defstruct name: "", paid: false, over_18: true
  def may_attend_after_party(attendee = %Attendee{}) do
    attendee.paid && attendee.over_18
  end
  def print_vip_badge(%Attendee{name: name}) when name != "" do
    IO.puts "Very cheap badge for #{name}"
  end
  def print_vip_badge(%Attendee{}) do
    raise "missing name for badge"
  end
end

$ iex defstruct1.exs
iex> a1 = %Attendee{name: "Dave", over_18: true}
%Attendee{name: "Dave", over_18: true, paid: false}
iex> Attendee.may_attend_after_party(a1)
false
iex> a2 = %Attendee{a1 | paid: true}
%Attendee{name: "Dave", over_18: true, paid: true}
iex> Attendee.may_attend_after_party(a2)
true
iex(22)> Attendee.print_vip_badge(a2)
Very cheap badge for Dave
:ok
iex(23)> a3 = %Attendee{}
%Attendee{name: "", over_18: true, paid: false}
iex(26)> Attendee.print_vip_badge(a3)
** (RuntimeError) missing name for badge
defstruct1.exs:13: Attendee.print_vip_badge/1

Sets

目前只有一种实现：HashSet

iex> set1 = Enum.into 1..5, HashSet.new
#HashSet<[1, 2, 3, 4, 5]>
iex> Set.member? set1, 3
true
iex> set2 = Enum.into 3..8, HashSet.new
#HashSet<[3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8]>
iex> Set.union set1, set2
#HashSet<[7, 6, 4, 1, 8, 2, 3, 5]>
iex> Set.difference set1, set2
#HashSet<[1, 2]>
iex> Set.difference set2, set1
#HashSet<[6, 7, 8]>
iex> Set.intersection set1, set2
#HashSet<[3, 4, 5]>

What are types

Elixir中的数据，既是有primitive type，又有List，Keyword这些抽象module，这可以看作是一种duck type,类似于动态面向对象语言。

iex> options = [ {:width, 72}, {:style, "light"}, {:style, "print"} ]
[width: 72, style: "light", style: "print"]
iex> List.last options
{:style, "print"}
iex> Keyword.get_values options, :style
["light", "print"]

Processing Collections–Enums and Stream

Elixir中提供2个关于iteration的module

  1. Enum: Processing collections
  2. Stream: Lazy enumerables

Enum

Stream

  1. Stream.cycle
  2. Stream.repeatly
  3. Stream.iterate
  4. Stream.unfold
  5. Stream.resource

Collectable protocol

Collectable protocol和Enumermable相反，通过插入元素来创建collection

Collectable的API是底层使用的较多，用户通常通过Enum.into和comprehension来使用。

Comprehension

String and Binaries

Control Flow

Organizing a Project

entry.title: rubymotion for android
entry.content:
rubymotion for android

等了很久的rubymotion for android终于可以用了。按照官方网站升级:

  1. update rubymotion
  2. install android sdk
  3. install android ndk
  4. uncompress sdk and ndk
  5. set environment variable
  6. motion create –template=android AndroidHello
  7. rake device 最后一步出现错误：
ERROR! It looks like your version of the NDK does not support API level L.

寻找原因:

先运行android升级到最新的sdk, 最后在这里看到如何设置 api version

Motion::Project::App.setup do |app|
  app.name = "MyAndroidMotionApp"
  app.api_version = "19"
end

entry.title: edit require gem in vim
entry.content:
如何快速看某个rubygem的代码

在console下，可以安装gem-browse,用命令gem open sinatra,就会进入编辑器看这个gem的代码。

在vim看require的gem

可以利用gem-browse，用以下的mapping进入光标下require gem的代码

nnoremap gr :execute ":tabedit " . system("gem open -e echo " . expand("<cword>"))<CR>

如果需要和Gemfile里的版本相同，需要改用bundle show命令。

nnoremap gr :execute ":tabedit " . system("bundle show " . expand("<cword>"))<CR>

entry.title: alignment for ruby symbol in vim
entry.content:
在编辑器里做代码对齐

为了提高阅读性， 应尽量使其美观，对齐是其中一种方式。ruby中的symbol使用广泛，为了对其他们，需要使用一个vim插件Tabular

symbol in ruby1.8

使用下面key mapping，可以对齐ruby1.8的symbol

vmap <leader>a> :Tabularize /:/r1c0l0<CR>:Tabularize /=>/l1c1l0<CR>

#before alignment
mymethod arg1, :a => 1,
  :c => 3,
  :sdfds => 23,
  :fsd => 2

#after alignment
mymethod arg1, :a     => 1,
               :c     => 3,
               :sdfds => 23,
               :fsd   => 2

symbol in ruby1.9

使用下面key mapping，可以对齐ruby1.9以后的symbol

vmap <leader>a: :Tabularize /:/r0c1l0<CR>

#before alignment
mymethod arg1, a: 21,
  bd: 234,
  ccccc: 43434

#after alignment
mymethod arg1, a: 21,
              bd: 234,
           ccccc: 43434

entry.title: prawnpdf
entry.content:
Prawn

Prawn是用于生成pdf的ruby库。了解它的使用方法它的最快途径是看它的manual

Manual的内容

  1. Basic concepts
  2. Graphics
  3. Text
  4. Bounding box
  5. Layout
  6. Table
  7. Images
  8. Documents and page options
  9. Outline
  10. Repeatable content
  11. Security

Basic Concepts

这部分包括

  1. Creation
  2. Origin
  3. Cursor
  4. Other cursor helper
  5. Adding pages
  6. Measurement
  7. View

Creation

有3种方式

# Assignment
pdf = Prawn::Document.new
pdf.text "Hello World"
pdf.render_file "assignment.pdf"
# Implicit Block
Prawn::Document.generate("implicit.pdf") do
text "Hello World"
end
# Explicit Block
Prawn::Document.generate("explicit.pdf") do |pdf|
pdf.text "Hello World"
end

Origin

  1. document的坐标起点[0,0]是左下角
  2. bouncing box是用于插入内容的边框,注意它位置的坐标是位于它的左上角
  3. 每个文档都至少有一个bouncing box,就是margin box

下面代码画出文档坐标，bouncing box边框，以及在两个原点画圈

stroke_axis
stroke_circle [0, 0], 10
bounding_box([100, 300], :width => 300, :height => 200) do
  stroke_bounds
  stroke_circle [0, 0], 10
end

Cursor

Cursor指定插入内容的位置，从文档的左上角开始往下

stroke_axis

text "the cursor is here: #{cursor}"
text "now it is here: #{cursor}"

move_down 200
text "on the first move the cursor went down to: #{cursor}"

move_up 100
text "on the second move the cursor went up to: #{cursor}"

move_cursor_to 50
text "on the last move the cursor went directly to: #{cursor}"

其他 Cursor Helper

pad和css里的padding相似 float在显示内容后把cursor恢复之前位置

stroke_horizontal_rule
pad(20) { text "Text padded both before and after." }

stroke_horizontal_rule
pad_top(20) { text "Text padded on the top." }

stroke_horizontal_rule
pad_bottom(20) { text "Text padded on the bottom." }

stroke_horizontal_rule
move_down 30

text "Text written before the float block."

float do
  move_down 30
  bounding_box([0, cursor], :width => 200) do
    text "Text written inside the float block."
    stroke_bounds
  end
end

text "Text written after the float block."

Adding new page

text "We are still on the initial page for this example. Now I'll ask " +
"Prawn to gently start a new page. Please follow me to the next page."

start_new_page

text "See. We've left the previous page behind."

Measurement

Prawn里基本单位是point，每个point是1/72英寸 只需要 require “prawn/measurement_extensions”, Numeric类就具有那些helper方法

require "prawn/measurement_extensions"
[:mm, :cm, :dm, :m, :in, :yd, :ft].each do |measurement|
text "1 #{measurement} in PDF Points: #{1.send(measurement)} pt"
move_down 5.mm
end

输出

1 mm in PDF Points: 2.834645669291339 pt
1 cm in PDF Points: 28.34645669291339 pt
1 dm in PDF Points: 283.46456692913387 pt
1 m in PDF Points: 2834.645669291339 pt
1 in in PDF Points: 72 pt
1 yd in PDF Points: 2592 pt
1 ft in PDF Points: 864 pt

view

当要使用自定义的类，应该用mixin。 也可以定义一个document()方法，返回一个符合Prawn::Document protocol的对象，所有方法会代理到那个对象。

class Greeter
  include Prawn::View
  def initialize(name)
    @name = name
  end
  def say_hello
    text "Hello, #{@name}!"
  end
  def say_goodbye
    font("Courier") do
      text "Goodbye, #{@name}!"
    end
  end
end
greeter = Greeter.new("Gregory")
greeter.say_hello
greeter.say_goodbye
greeter.save_as("greetings.pdf")

Graphics

  1. Basics
  2. Shapes
  3. Fill and Stroke settings
  4. Transformations

Basics

  1. helpers: stroke_axis
  2. fill and stroke

fill 和 stroke是最终画出图形的方法，其他的方法只是定义了drawing path，例如 rectangle, circle or line_to

stroke_axis

# No block
line [0, 200], [100, 150]
stroke

rectangle [0, 100], 100, 100
fill

# With block
stroke { line [200, 200], [300, 150] }
fill { rectangle [200, 100], 100, 100 }

# Method hook
stroke_line [400, 200], [500, 150]
fill_rectangle [400, 100], 100, 100

Shapes

Filling and Stroke Setting

注意，由于Ruby认为=左边的是局部变量，而不是函数调用，当设置line_width时，需要加上self

entry.title: encoding message
entry.content:
关于practicingruby

practicingruby是Gregory Brown定期撰写的关于ruby编程的文章。很有深度，欢迎大家订阅。

The anatomy of information in software systems

9月份的文章是关于如何把消息编码。内容如下的IRC消息，应该如何解释

PRIVMSG #practicing ruby testing :Seasons greetings to you all!\r\n

在ruby里可以表示为

["PRIVMSG", "#practicing ruby testing", "Seasons greetings to you all!"]

序列化为字符串

使用Msgpack序列化上面的消息,得到的HEX是

93 a7 50 52 49 56 4d 53 47 b8 23 70 72 61 63 74 69 63 69 6e 67 2d 72 75 62 
79 2d 74 65 73 74 69 6e 67 bd 53 65 61 73 6f 6e 73 20 67 72 65 65 74 69 6e 
67 73 20 74 6f 20 79 6f 75 20 61 6c 6c 21

In Ruby:

"\x93\xA7PRIVMSG\xB8#practicing-ruby-testing\xBDSeasons greetings to you all!"

分解它的结构得到：

其中93, A7, B8, BD有特定含义, 实际上A0到BF表示的是0到31 byte的string

>> 0xA7-0xA0
=> 7
>> "PRIVMSG".size
=> 7

>> 0xB8-0xA0
=> 24
>> "#practicing-ruby-testing".size
=> 24

>> 0xBD-0xA0
=> 29
>> "Seasons greetings to you all!".size
=> 29

结构化

不仅是得到字符串数组，我们还要明确每个部分的意义，可以用MessagePack’s application-specific type

分解后得到的是

ruby decode 代码

data_types = { 1 => CommandName, 2 => Parameter, 3 => MessageBody }

command = MessagePackDecoder.unpack(raw_bytes, data_types)
#  [ CommandName <"PRIVMSG">, 
#    Parameter   <"#practicing-ruby-testing">, 
#    MessageBody <"Season greetings to you all!"> ]

handler decode的例子代码

class Parameter
  def initialize(byte_array)
    @text = byte_array.pack("C*")

    raise ArgumentError if @text.include?(" ")
  end

  attr_reader :text
end

使用语法规则定义结构

上面的方法虽然让计算机容易理解消息的结构，但让人去理解就困难了。

如果使用Augmented Backus–Naur Form语法规则，可以表示如下

message    =  command [ params ] crlf
command    =  1*letter / 3digit
params     =  *14( SPACE middle ) [ SPACE ":" trailing ]
           =/ 14( SPACE middle ) [ SPACE [ ":" ] trailing ]

nospcrlfcl =  %x01-09 / %x0B-0C / %x0E-1F / %x21-39 / %x3B-FF
                ; any octet except NUL, CR, LF, " " and ":"

middle     =  nospcrlfcl *( ":" / nospcrlfcl )
trailing   =  *( ":" / " " / nospcrlfcl )

SPACE      =  %x20        ; space character
crlf       =  %x0D %x0A   ; "carriage return" "linefeed"
letter     =  %x41-5A / %x61-7A       ; A-Z / a-z
digit      =  %x30-39                 ; 0-9

在ruby，我们用citrus

grammar IRC
  rule message
    (command params? endline) {
      { :command => capture(:command).value,
        :params  => capture(:params).value }
    }
  end

  rule command
    letters | three_digit_code 
  end

  rule params
    ( ((space middle)14*14 (space ":"? trailing)?) |
      ((space middle)*14 (space ":" trailing)?) ) {
      captures.fetch(:middle, []) + captures.fetch(:trailing, [])
    }
  end

  rule middle
    non_special (non_special | ":")*
  end

  rule trailing
    (non_special | space | ":")+
  end

  rule letters
    [a-zA-Z]+
  end

  rule three_digit_code
    /\d{3}/ { to_str.to_i }
  end

  rule non_special
    [^\0:\r\n ]
  end

  rule space
    " "
  end

  rule endline
    "\r\n"
  end
end


require 'citrus'
Citrus.load('irc')

msg = "PRIVMSG #practicing-ruby-testing :Seasons greetings to you all!\r\n"

data = IRC.parse(msg).value

p data[:command] 
#=> "PRIVMSG"

p data[:params]
#=> ["#practicing-ruby-testing", "Seasons greetings to you all!"]
